title: "Distribution"-focused install/get
body:
https://github.com/datalad/datalad/issues/3759 and https://github.com/datalad/datalad/pull/3918 revealed a substantial conflict between the desired behaviors from the POV of the system described in the handbook and the data distribution aspects pointed out by @yarikoptic

I see no straightforward way to combine them in a single command. And I also see no need to do so either.

There are many non-exclusive paths to go from the status quo

- implement a new command (pair?) for data distribution handling in an extension, which would essentially exhibit the behavior of 0.11 `install/get`, maybe even prior to 0.11

- replace `install` in the handbook with `clone`. This is largely a rename, nothing in the book uses any features of `install` that `clone` doesn't provide. Also some explanations become unecessary, because the `source` option is no longer a special thing.

- Rename 0.12 `get` to something else, and maintain the old `get` as-is (and with it `install`). This also requires a rename in the handbook, as the path semantics would no longer match.
